main

Class Router

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Router
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Crossbar, Crux, Cygnus, ODOR, OpticalRouter, OXY

    public abstract class Router
extends java.lang.Object
    Is the abstract base class for all the custom routers defined in the routers package. A Router object encapsulates the specific features of a type of router that are needed when instantiating a NoC architecture. This information includes:
    • The number of ports
    • The number of waveguides
    • The number of crossings
    • The number of microring resonators
    • The inner architecture of the router including the position of each building blocks (waveguides, crossings, microring resonators)
    • The power loss and crosstalk characteristics of this router

    A custom router that extends this abstract class must implement the initialize method in order to proper set the different router architectures

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        protected abstract void initialize()
        Initializes the router object. This method must be implemented in every custom router class. The initialize method must set three class variables that every router should customize according to its inner architecture:
        • rings, the map containing the ring objects
        • crossings, the map containing the crossing objects
        • waveguides, the map containing the waveguide objects

      • isValidSimultaneousCommunication

        public boolean isValidSimultaneousCommunication(int p_in0,
                                       int p_out0,
                                       int p_in1,
                                       int p_out1)
        Evaluates if two concurrent communications are feasible
        Parameters:
        p_in0 - the input port of communication 0
        p_out0 - the output port of communication 0
        p_in1 - the input port of communication 1
        p_out1 - the output port of communication 1
        Returns:
        true if the two communication don't share any waveguide; false otherwise

      • areSharedWaveguides

        public boolean areSharedWaveguides(java.util.List<BuildingBlock> path_i,
                          java.util.List<BuildingBlock> path_j)
        Evaluates if two paths contain the same waveguide.
        Parameters:
        path_i - the list containing all the building blocks that are crossed by the signal i
        path_j - the list containing all the building blocks that are crossed by the signal j
        Returns:
        true if the two paths share at least a single waveguide; false otherwise
